review_title: Great benefits but supervisors who don't care
pros: Great benefits and they provide fun family activates every once in a while. They are very giving.
cons: The pay is not good. (Which is why they can afford those benefits and activities lol) And the higher ups don't care about their employees. They are all "friends" and mutually continue to be careless of their employees. Very unprofessional.

review_title: Zero integrity from management. When downsizing, will try to concoct false reasons to lay you off or fire you.
pros: None unless you enjoy low pay and rarely being approved for any time off or unless you enjoy working understaffed every shift.
cons: Dishonest supervisors, managers, & HR. Very cold management. Very judgmental of front line workers. Zero training. Zero upward mobility. Company is downsizing. Company is not profitable.
Would like a little more vacation per year.

pros: Easy entry level job to get and make extra money on top of your social security disability.
cons: No benefits to part-time employees and low wages.

pros: Great crew, kind of good for school, if the company isn't busy
cons: The company takes the clients side and only cares if it affects them. Your just someone who can be replaced. Most clients aren't trying to get better, they are just looking for a roof over there heads and the company doesn't care, because Medicaid pays them.

review_title: Coworkers are mostly good, most management is not.
job_title: Human Services Technician in Layton, UT
pros: Most coworkers are competent and good at doing their jobs.
cons: Management (doctors, some therapists) are not very concerned with the well-being and safety of the technicians and will admit anyone, no matter how rude, ill, or difficult to deal with the client has been in the past. Health insurance for full-time employees is terrible.

job_title: Human Service Technician in Ogden, UT
pros: Great bosses, organized, good coworkers, fun experience
cons: Stress, difficult clients at times, drama

job_title: Peer Support Specialist in Kaysville, UT
Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in Layton, UT
pros: Friendly employees, nice location and building
cons: incompetent staff, poor communication, punishment for mandatory trainings, PTO, etc.

pros: The majority of the employees are fun and easy to get along with.
cons: While working here I found it is VERY difficult to advance. It's often not necessarily who would do best in a position, rather who gets along best with the supervisor of that position. If someone doesn't like you for whatever reason, just count on never advancing. Also there is no recognition for hard working employees. If you work hard and do your job right they just pile more work on you without showing any appreciation. However if you don't do your job and are rude to the clients They will recognize you and give you rewards. Oh and  DONT expect any raises because that's not going to happen either.

pros: They were very understanding about the ups and downs of life and were accommodating. They weren't concerned about tattoos or gauges when hiring employees. The work was important and allowed for human connection.
cons: Was never properly trained in the on-the-job procedures. And sometimes the scheduling would get a little crazy.

review_title: Awesome non-profit organization with meaningful work
pros: Fantastic work culture, Sense of work fulfillment, Great support for new ideas, regular social events  and nice benefits.
cons: Lack of a new hire orientation program and regular skills development sessions

pros: Schedule flexibility, paid trainings and workshops
cons: Low pay for an emotionally exhausting position as a mental health and substance abuse therapist. Administration has moved toward focusing on $ and numbers rather than effective and client-centered treatment.

pros: DBH- opportunity to grow, healthy environment, nice people, pleanty of work
cons: Can be stressful working with certain clients. Sometimes not enough support

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Autonomy, trust, and room to create an individualized work environment. Great support from supervisors! Opportunities for advancement.
cons: 45 minute commute from Salt Lake City
